facts.fact_text: Greece's trade deficit widened to EUR 3.6 billion in December 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: The trade deficit in Greece widened slightly to EUR 3.6 billion in December 2025 from a revised EUR 3.5 billion in the same month a year ago.

facts.fact_text: The trade gap in December 2025 was the largest since November 2022.

evidences.evidence_text: This was the largest trade gap since November 2022, as imports rose more than exports.

facts.fact_text: Imports grew by 1.5% year-on-year to EUR 7.7 billion.

evidences.evidence_text: Imports grew by 1.5% year-on-year to EUR 7.7 billion, driven mainly by increased purchases from the EU (9.1%), which more than offset a drop in imports from third countries (-7.9%).

facts.fact_text: Exports increased by 0.7% to EUR 4.1 billion.

evidences.evidence_text: Meanwhile, exports increased by 0.7% to EUR 4.1 billion due to higher sales to the EU (11.8%), while shipments to the third countries declined (-11.5%).

facts.fact_text: For the whole year of 2025, the country's trade gap narrowed to EUR 33.5 billion from EUR 35.6 billion in 2024.

evidences.evidence_text: For the whole year of 2025, the country's trade gap narrowed to EUR 33.5 billion from EUR 35.6 billion in 2024, with exports (-2.8%) falling less than imports (-4.1%).

facts.fact_text: Exports fell less than imports in 2025.

evidences.evidence_text: For the whole year of 2025, the country's trade gap narrowed to EUR 33.5 billion from EUR 35.6 billion in 2024, with exports (-2.8%) falling less than imports (-4.1%).

evidence.evidence_text: The trade deficit in Greece widened slightly to EUR 3.6 billion in December 2025 from a revised EUR 3.5 billion in the same month a year ago.
Imports grew by 1.5% year-on-year to EUR 7.7 billion
Meanwhile, exports increased by 0.7% to EUR 4.1 billion
